text:
Company: Griffith-Richard

Role: Investigator Trainee

Company Background:
Griffith-Richard is a leading private investigative firm known for delivering comprehensive and intricate investigative services to our clientele. Our team consists of seasoned professionals with a passion for justice and a commitment to excellence.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Description:
Griffith-Richard is seeking an Investigator Trainee to join our dynamic team. This entry-level position requires individuals with a keen eye for detail, strong analytical skills, and a drive to uncover the truth in complex scenarios. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work alongside experienced investigators and gain hands-on experience in the field.

Responsibilities:
- Assist in gathering and analyzing evidence.
- Conduct background checks and surveillance operations.
- Prepare detailed reports of findings.
- Collaborate with senior investigators on various cases.
- Maintain confidentiality and integrity in all operations.

Qualifications and Experience Needed:
- A bachelor's degree in Criminal Justice, Criminology, or related fields preferred.
- Strong analytical and observational skills.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
- Previous experience in a related field is a plus but not mandatory.
- Must be able to pass a comprehensive background check.

Perks and Benefits:
- Competitive commission structure.
- Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
- Flexible working hours and a supportive team environment.
- Comprehensive health and wellness benefits.
- Compensation is negotiable based on the candidate’s background and what they bring to the table.

How to Apply:
Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume and cover letter detailing their qualifications and experience. Griffith-Richard is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates.

Note: Due to the sensitive nature of our work, all applicants must be able to undergo and pass a thorough background check.
